reviewText: Repeat. Repeat. Repeat. Repeat. I have no idea who would want to endure that, but you'd have to be pretty patient and crazy to be able to. The overall idea is cool, I've always wanted to learn how to do some country dance moves but her sh*t is boring and lame and all you do is do the same thing over and over and over and over again. I strongly recommend you not buy this DVD.
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party

reviewText: its ok just not the best dance DVD I've ever seen.  I was hoping for a little livelier mood to the DVD
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party

reviewText: It is not as hard as I thought, but it is still hard and good to do which I like it
summary: Dance off the Inches County Line Dance Party
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party

reviewText: need to exercise and thought this way would make it fun for me.  no problems with this vendor at all
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party

reviewText: This is a fun way to exercise but due to an ankle problem I can't do it as much as I'd like.
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party

reviewText: I have not had the opportunity to learn dance of any sort.  Every since I was a little girl I loved Fred Astaire, Shirley Temple and dancing in general etc.  Line dance looks like great fun.  The instructor is excellent in my opinion and I am learning a new thing which improves the brain cells. Also I am burning more calaries beside Kathy Smith workouts, Mari Winsor's pilates, and Callan's Callenetics which are really wonderful.  I like to be active and I enjoy variety.I recommend this to anyone who wants to branch out from their normal routine. Get it and expect to have fun learning....
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party

reviewText: Basically, I'm not coordinated enough to do it. I have zero rhythm and can't dance at all - not even line dancing which is supposedly easier than some of the other styles. Yes, it's fun, but I get a little bit lost in it all (mostly because some of the transitions feel awkward to me). The music, as others have said, is terrible. Overall, the workout itself is not bad. I wouldn't recommend it, but I wouldn't tell someone not to get it (thus the three-star rating). I occasionally do it, and do sweat some, so I figure if I'm burning calories it doesn't matter if I get the moves exactly right as long as I'm not hurting myself in the process.
summary: Good if you like line dancing, bad if you're uncoordinated
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party

reviewText: Dance Off the Inches: Country Line Dance Party! is an enthusiastic fitness DVD with a wild country twist. Getting in shape can be a blast, and instructor Amy Blackburn shows how country line dance shuffles, kicks, and stomps can burn fat and boost energy. A "Dance Off the Inches Step Guide" quickly familiarizes the viewer with the 10 steps needed to enjoy the whole program. "Country Line Dance Party" is a user-friendly workout for viewers of all ages and backgrounds, and deserves a place in DVD fitness libraries dedicated to cardiovascular health, variety, and just plain fun.
summary: A user-friendly workout for viewers of all ages and backgrounds
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party

reviewText: You are not going to get an intense cardio burn but this DVD is kind of fun if you enjoy dancing for exercise. It is not difficult to understand the dance steps and the music is fun. Overall I enjoy this exercise DVD.
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party

reviewText: I was excited about this DVD thinking that I would learn the 'country dance steps' & loose weight having fun.  I was seriously disappointed when I watched it knowing that it was only for those that are familiar with the country dance steps & a quick learner.I've gotten very little use from this item because it has too many different types of dance steps, moves toooo fast & as she tells you 'right or left' & uses the names of the steps (you need to focus on the fact that she is facing you & you have to do the opposite directon), it is overwhelming to try & keep up & LOTS OF PRACTICE is needed before you are familiar with all of the steps & can actually follow the exercise portion of the DVD.  It also would have been helpful if she wasn't standing the opposite way while teaching the steps - know that you are learning the opposit way!On the positive side, the dance step are separate from the 'exercise' portion of the DVD & you can rewind/repeat as often as necessary.  I just didn't have the time to practice as much as needed!
Title: Dance Off The Inches: Country Line Dance Party
